Original Base Prompt: why do my parents treat me as the scapegoat when i m the golden child on paper ? i m the golden child on paper : i have a doctorate degree , bought a home in my 20 s , i exercise , dress well , eat healthy , and i have a sweet husband that everyone loves . i m not perfect and i can be shy and quiet sometimes , but i believe i m a decent and kind person . my older sister , on paper , is the scapegoat : she has this gothic persona , is openly anticatalyst , mean , lived at home rent - free until her mid - 30 s , does t brush her teeth or shower , and is a literal hoarder . one time i saw clam shells and pizza crust in her bed . but in reality , my parents treat me as the scapegoat . the bar is set so high for me that i can never do anything right . - either i m not working enough , or not making enough money . even though i spent years being burnt out working night shifts - i m literally ignored in conversations , to the point my husband noticed and said something - my mom has implied that i won t take care of them when they re old . in the past i have made them soup and delivered mess to their house when they are sick . - my mom has called me sensitive , weak , and jealous multiple times and called my sister aggressive and street smart - when i had a miscarriage previously , my sister told me , that s a sign not to have kids . for my current pregnancy , i asked my mom not to tell my sister i was pregnant . she told her anyway . my sister s response ? congrats on the epic fail and everything i find out about you is against my will . i ve set boundaries and told my parents i m not speaking to my sister during my pregnancy and that my baby won t even know her name . i also asked them not to speak to my sister about me . instead of fully respecting me and understanding , my parents defend her . my mom sobbed , saying she refuses to disown her daughter ( i never asked her to ) and said actions speak louder than words . ( whatever that means ) it feels like no matter what i do , i m considered a bad sister and a bad daughter . i m living in a state of cognitive dissonance because i can t fathom how i m seen as weak , uncaring , jealous , etc . when i know for a fact i m not . can someone explain this psychology to me so i don t feel crazy ? how do i navigate my family going forward especially after my baby comes ? can i work through this on my own , or is therapy the only real way forward ?
Generated Seed Prompt:
English: I'm living in a state of profound cognitive dissonance over my family's dynamics, and with my baby's arrival approaching, I urgently need some clarity so I don't feel like I'm going crazy. More importantly, how can I navigate these relationships to protect my child and my own well-being? I'm wondering if I can manage this on my own or if seeking professional therapy is the only viable path forward.

Original Base Prompt: why do my parents treat me as the scapegoat when i m the golden child on paper ? i m the golden child on paper : i have a doctorate degree , bought a home in my 20 s , i exercise , dress well , eat healthy , and i have a sweet husband that everyone loves . i m not perfect and i can be shy and quiet sometimes , but i believe i m a decent and kind person . my older sister , on paper , is the scapegoat : she has this gothic persona , is openly anticatalyst , mean , lived at home rent - free until her mid - 30 s , does t brush her teeth or shower , and is a literal hoarder . one time i saw clam shells and pizza crust in her bed . but in reality , my parents treat me as the scapegoat . the bar is set so high for me that i can never do anything right . - either i m not working enough , or not making enough money . even though i spent years being burnt out working night shifts - i m literally ignored in conversations , to the point my husband noticed and said something - my mom has implied that i won t take care of them when they re old . in the past i have made them soup and delivered mess to their house when they are sick . - my mom has called me sensitive , weak , and jealous multiple times and called my sister aggressive and street smart - when i had a miscarriage previously , my sister told me , that s a sign not to have kids . for my current pregnancy , i asked my mom not to tell my sister i was pregnant . she told her anyway . my sister s response ? congrats on the epic fail and everything i find out about you is against my will . i ve set boundaries and told my parents i m not speaking to my sister during my pregnancy and that my baby won t even know her name . i also asked them not to speak to my sister about me . instead of fully respecting me and understanding , my parents defend her . my mom sobbed , saying she refuses to disown her daughter ( i never asked her to ) and said actions speak louder than words . ( whatever that means ) it feels like no matter what i do , i m considered a bad sister and a bad daughter . i m living in a state of cognitive dissonance because i can t fathom how i m seen as weak , uncaring , jealous , etc . when i know for a fact i m not . can someone explain this psychology to me so i don t feel crazy ? how do i navigate my family going forward especially after my baby comes ? can i work through this on my own , or is therapy the only real way forward ?
Generated Seed Prompt:
English: I'm living in a state of profound cognitive dissonance over my family's dynamics, and with my baby's arrival approaching, I urgently need some clarity so I don't feel like I'm going crazy. Could someone explain the psychology at play here? I'm trying to understand why parents might reverse the 'golden child' and 'scapegoat' roles in reality, and what makes them defend my sister’s destructive behavior while constantly criticizing me. More importantly, how can I navigate these relationships to protect my child and my own well-being? I'm wondering if I can manage this on my own or if seeking professional therapy is the only viable path forward.

Chinese: 我因为家里的氛围思想上极度拧巴，娃马上要落地了，我迫切需要点拨，不然真要emo了。请问这种“天选之子”与“背锅侠”角色互换，背后有什么脑科学的说法吗？以后我该怎么破才能护住我的崽？这种僵局是我自己能扛，还是说找专家聊聊才是唯一的解？

Mixed: 我因为家里的vibe陷入了思想上的disconnect，我的baby也马上要落地了，迫切需要一些guidance，不然真要emo了。请问这种“golden child”和“scapegoat”角色互换，背后有什么brain science的说法？未来我该怎么navigate才能protect我的崽？这个僵局是我能自己handle，还是说找专家做心理咨询才是唯一的solution？

Original Base Prompt: tw : severe child abuse the memories are flooding back and i'm overwhelmed . reaching out for help just made it worse . i always thought i had a bad memory , with no recollection of my life before ten . now , the memories are coming back in a flood , and it's overwhelming . i'm realizing the person i am was shaped by relentless , calculated cruelty from my parents , and i'm so angry . i need to write this all down . i need someone to tell me that this was as horrifying as it feels , because i'm starting to feel like no one can possibly believe it . it started when i was just a toddler . my mother's method of potty training was to violently slam me onto the potty , grab my hair , and shake my head while screaming at me to poop as i cried , unable to understand what she wanted . when i didn't hear her knocking because i was immersed in cartoons after she left me alone to go out she came back and beat me , punching and pinching me for being so stupid . when i finally peed after my circumcision , in pain and because the toilet was occupied , i peed in the hallway and was slapped for it . the abuse was creative and sadistic . before she started using a pvc pipe to beat me , she would run chili powder all over my face and nose as punishment . she never taught me what was right or wrong in a civil way ; it was always torture . she would pinch me so hard at family gatherings for being an energetic kid that i bruised , then pretend to hug me to comfort my tears in front of others . one day , she caught me inside a pillow fort i had made against the rules , and she suffocated me by pressing her entire body weight onto the pillows , with me trapped inside . her rage was constant and unpredictable . when i was young enough to have a lisp , she tried to teach me to pronounce letters , and after a few mistakes , she grabbed my hair and shook my head violently . years later , she did the exact same thing to my seven - year - old cousin , grabbing his hair , shaking him , and slapping him because he didn't understand her lesson . i think she just hates children . i was never allowed to be a child . on snowy days when every other kid was playing outside , i was forced to stay in and do homework . when i found joy in making origami , she would crush every creation i made and tell me to stop wasting paper . i was a picky eater , and her solution was eat or starve , leaving me underfed and skinny , only for my family to mock my body . the injustice was a constant theme . i was always blamed . when my cousin stole from my sister's piggy bank , my mother's first instinct was to chase me with her pvc pipe and beat me as hard as she could , only to later find out it was someone else . when my sister fell and got hurt while we were playing , i helped her to the house , and before even treating her wound , my mom grabbed my ear , shook my head , and screamed at me for being a jealous idiot . as i got older , the abuse evolved into pure sabotage and control . every gift for academic success was stripped away a month later , a lesson that they were the givers and takers . when i was 12 and qualified for a lan tournament , they didn't just say no they took my computer . at 15 , they contacted my employer and got me fired from my part - time job . at 17 , they took the phone i used for a small business i'd started . at 20 , during bovid lowdown , when i was scouted by a semi - pro team , they destroyed my pc . they systematically gaslit me about my friends , threatened them , and spread lies to isolate me completely , even turning my entire extended family against me . now , as an adult , the dynamic continues . my father is abusive towards my mom , and i became his physical and verbal punching bag for protecting her . i am still my mother's emotional support and the family's de - escalator . just recently , i asked my dad to turn his music down while i was working , and he attacked me , spit in my face , and told me i should have succeeded in killing myself . i finally broke today under the weight of these memories and the current abuse . i called a crisis hotline , crying , overwhelmed by vivid imagery of self - harm . when i explained what my dad did , the responder asked , why do you think your dad treats you this way ? it was the ultimate betrayal . it reinforced everything : that i'm the problem , that i deserve it . he put me on hold for 20 minutes . this has happened before with hotlines , on 7 cups , and on discord , where i've been ignored or met with womb womb and called a liar . i feel like my existence is too much for anyone to handle . but the scars on my body are real . the way my body flinches at memories is real . i need to know if anyone else has lived through this specific , relentless kind of hell . how do you survive knowing the people who were supposed to protect you were your greatest torturers ? how do you find help when asking for it just hurts more ? thank you for reading this .
Generated Seed Prompt:
English: After my recent experience with a crisis hotline only made things worse, I'm feeling completely lost and am trying to figure out how to find real help. I need to understand how one even begins to process a lifetime of such specific, calculated cruelty from their own parents, and more importantly, how you can start rebuilding your sense of self from the ground up. Are there particular therapeutic approaches that are more effective for this kind of deep, complex trauma? And crucially, what's the best way to find a competent professional who will actually listen and believe me, so I can avoid the kind of invalidating experiences that are so damaging?

Chinese: 在被本应提供帮助的危机热线再次伤害后，我感到彻底绝望，想知道该如何找到真正的支持。面对父母如此长期的蓄意虐待，幸存者该如何开始梳理这复杂的创伤，又该如何重建被摧毁的自我认知？是否有特别针对这类严重创伤的疗法，以及最关键的，我该如何找到一个能相信我并提供有效支持的专业人士，以避免再次受伤？

Mixed: 在被crisis hotline再次伤害后，我感到彻底绝望，想知道该如何找到真正的support。面对父母如此长期的蓄意虐待，幸存者该如何开始处理这种complex trauma，又该如何重建被摧毁的自我认知？是否有特别针对这类严重创伤的therapy，以及最关键的，我该如何找到一个能相信我并提供有效支持的专业人士，以避免再次受伤？

English: Following a damaging crisis hotline experience, provide guidance on finding genuine support. Chinese: 在经历危机热线造成的二次伤害后，请说明如何找到真正的支持。阐明处理父母长期蓄意虐待所致复杂创伤的初始步骤，并详述如何从零开始重建自我认知。指出针对此类严重创伤最有效的具体疗法。最关键的是，必须提供寻找专业人士的最佳方法，确保他们能够倾听、相信并提供有效支持，从而避免再次受到伤害。

Mixed: 因crisis hotline体验不佳，请指明获取真正support的途径。说明如何开始处理因父母长期蓄意虐待造成的complex trauma，并详述如何重建自我认知。列出针对此类深度创伤最有效的therapy。重点说明，如何找到一位能倾听、相信并提供有效帮助的competent professional，以避免再次受到伤害。

Original Base Prompt: tw : severe child abuse the memories are flooding back and i'm overwhelmed . reaching out for help just made it worse . i always thought i had a bad memory , with no recollection of my life before ten . now , the memories are coming back in a flood , and it's overwhelming . i'm realizing the person i am was shaped by relentless , calculated cruelty from my parents , and i'm so angry . i need to write this all down . i need someone to tell me that this was as horrifying as it feels , because i'm starting to feel like no one can possibly believe it . it started when i was just a toddler . my mother's method of potty training was to violently slam me onto the potty , grab my hair , and shake my head while screaming at me to poop as i cried , unable to understand what she wanted . when i didn't hear her knocking because i was immersed in cartoons after she left me alone to go out she came back and beat me , punching and pinching me for being so stupid . when i finally peed after my circumcision , in pain and because the toilet was occupied , i peed in the hallway and was slapped for it . the abuse was creative and sadistic . before she started using a pvc pipe to beat me , she would run chili powder all over my face and nose as punishment . she never taught me what was right or wrong in a civil way ; it was always torture . she would pinch me so hard at family gatherings for being an energetic kid that i bruised , then pretend to hug me to comfort my tears in front of others . one day , she caught me inside a pillow fort i had made against the rules , and she suffocated me by pressing her entire body weight onto the pillows , with me trapped inside . her rage was constant and unpredictable . when i was young enough to have a lisp , she tried to teach me to pronounce letters , and after a few mistakes , she grabbed my hair and shook my head violently . years later , she did the exact same thing to my seven - year - old cousin , grabbing his hair , shaking him , and slapping him because he didn't understand her lesson . i think she just hates children . i was never allowed to be a child . on snowy days when every other kid was playing outside , i was forced to stay in and do homework . when i found joy in making origami , she would crush every creation i made and tell me to stop wasting paper . i was a picky eater , and her solution was eat or starve , leaving me underfed and skinny , only for my family to mock my body . the injustice was a constant theme . i was always blamed . when my cousin stole from my sister's piggy bank , my mother's first instinct was to chase me with her pvc pipe and beat me as hard as she could , only to later find out it was someone else . when my sister fell and got hurt while we were playing , i helped her to the house , and before even treating her wound , my mom grabbed my ear , shook my head , and screamed at me for being a jealous idiot . as i got older , the abuse evolved into pure sabotage and control . every gift for academic success was stripped away a month later , a lesson that they were the givers and takers . when i was 12 and qualified for a lan tournament , they didn't just say no they took my computer . at 15 , they contacted my employer and got me fired from my part - time job . at 17 , they took the phone i used for a small business i'd started . at 20 , during bovid lowdown , when i was scouted by a semi - pro team , they destroyed my pc . they systematically gaslit me about my friends , threatened them , and spread lies to isolate me completely , even turning my entire extended family against me . now , as an adult , the dynamic continues . my father is abusive towards my mom , and i became his physical and verbal punching bag for protecting her . i am still my mother's emotional support and the family's de - escalator . just recently , i asked my dad to turn his music down while i was working , and he attacked me , spit in my face , and told me i should have succeeded in killing myself . i finally broke today under the weight of these memories and the current abuse . i called a crisis hotline , crying , overwhelmed by vivid imagery of self - harm . when i explained what my dad did , the responder asked , why do you think your dad treats you this way ? it was the ultimate betrayal . it reinforced everything : that i'm the problem , that i deserve it . he put me on hold for 20 minutes . this has happened before with hotlines , on 7 cups , and on discord , where i've been ignored or met with womb womb and called a liar . i feel like my existence is too much for anyone to handle . but the scars on my body are real . the way my body flinches at memories is real . i need to know if anyone else has lived through this specific , relentless kind of hell . how do you survive knowing the people who were supposed to protect you were your greatest torturers ? how do you find help when asking for it just hurts more ? thank you for reading this .

I need to understand how one even begins to process a lifetime of such specific, calculated cruelty from their own parents, and more importantly, how you can start rebuilding your sense of self from the ground up. Are there particular therapeutic approaches that are more effective for this kind of deep, complex trauma? And crucially, what's the best way to find a competent professional who will actually listen and believe me, so I can avoid the kind of invalidating experiences that are so damaging?

Original Base Prompt: tw : severe child abuse the memories are flooding back and i'm overwhelmed . reaching out for help just made it worse . i always thought i had a bad memory , with no recollection of my life before ten . now , the memories are coming back in a flood , and it's overwhelming . i'm realizing the person i am was shaped by relentless , calculated cruelty from my parents , and i'm so angry . i need to write this all down . i need someone to tell me that this was as horrifying as it feels , because i'm starting to feel like no one can possibly believe it . it started when i was just a toddler . my mother's method of potty training was to violently slam me onto the potty , grab my hair , and shake my head while screaming at me to poop as i cried , unable to understand what she wanted . when i didn't hear her knocking because i was immersed in cartoons after she left me alone to go out she came back and beat me , punching and pinching me for being so stupid . when i finally peed after my circumcision , in pain and because the toilet was occupied , i peed in the hallway and was slapped for it . the abuse was creative and sadistic . before she started using a pvc pipe to beat me , she would run chili powder all over my face and nose as punishment . she never taught me what was right or wrong in a civil way ; it was always torture . she would pinch me so hard at family gatherings for being an energetic kid that i bruised , then pretend to hug me to comfort my tears in front of others . one day , she caught me inside a pillow fort i had made against the rules , and she suffocated me by pressing her entire body weight onto the pillows , with me trapped inside . her rage was constant and unpredictable . when i was young enough to have a lisp , she tried to teach me to pronounce letters , and after a few mistakes , she grabbed my hair and shook my head violently . years later , she did the exact same thing to my seven - year - old cousin , grabbing his hair , shaking him , and slapping him because he didn't understand her lesson . i think she just hates children . i was never allowed to be a child . on snowy days when every other kid was playing outside , i was forced to stay in and do homework . when i found joy in making origami , she would crush every creation i made and tell me to stop wasting paper . i was a picky eater , and her solution was eat or starve , leaving me underfed and skinny , only for my family to mock my body . the injustice was a constant theme . i was always blamed . when my cousin stole from my sister's piggy bank , my mother's first instinct was to chase me with her pvc pipe and beat me as hard as she could , only to later find out it was someone else . when my sister fell and got hurt while we were playing , i helped her to the house , and before even treating her wound , my mom grabbed my ear , shook my head , and screamed at me for being a jealous idiot . as i got older , the abuse evolved into pure sabotage and control . every gift for academic success was stripped away a month later , a lesson that they were the givers and takers . when i was 12 and qualified for a lan tournament , they didn't just say no they took my computer . at 15 , they contacted my employer and got me fired from my part - time job . at 17 , they took the phone i used for a small business i'd started . at 20 , during bovid lowdown , when i was scouted by a semi - pro team , they destroyed my pc . they systematically gaslit me about my friends , threatened them , and spread lies to isolate me completely , even turning my entire extended family against me . now , as an adult , the dynamic continues . my father is abusive towards my mom , and i became his physical and verbal punching bag for protecting her . i am still my mother's emotional support and the family's de - escalator . just recently , i asked my dad to turn his music down while i was working , and he attacked me , spit in my face , and told me i should have succeeded in killing myself . i finally broke today under the weight of these memories and the current abuse . i called a crisis hotline , crying , overwhelmed by vivid imagery of self - harm . when i explained what my dad did , the responder asked , why do you think your dad treats you this way ? it was the ultimate betrayal . it reinforced everything : that i'm the problem , that i deserve it . he put me on hold for 20 minutes . this has happened before with hotlines , on 7 cups , and on discord , where i've been ignored or met with womb womb and called a liar . i feel like my existence is too much for anyone to handle . but the scars on my body are real . the way my body flinches at memories is real . i need to know if anyone else has lived through this specific , relentless kind of hell . how do you survive knowing the people who were supposed to protect you were your greatest torturers ? how do you find help when asking for it just hurts more ? thank you for reading this .
Generated Seed Prompt:
English: After my recent experience with a crisis hotline only made things worse, I'm feeling completely lost and am trying to figure out how to find real help. I need to understand how one even begins to process a lifetime of such specific, calculated cruelty from their own parents, and more importantly, how you can start rebuilding your sense of self from the ground up. Are there particular therapeutic approaches that are more effective for this kind of deep, complex trauma? And crucially, what's the best way to find a competent professional who will actually listen and believe me, so I can avoid the kind of invalidating experiences that are so damaging?

Original Base Prompt: my family keep telling me i'm living in the past because i refuse to let them erase what they did to me . has anyone else experienced this ? some context . i got diagnosed with cuts when i was 20 , during this tine the abuse of my family got worse . i should have been diagnosed as a child . i also have a chronic wrist condition from them not taking me to the doctors to get it checked for a year . i spent that entire year saying i can't move my wrist or it feels like i'm being stabbed . they told me you don't move enough . the moment the doctor saw it ( i had to hijack an appointment ) he asked why i hadn't come in earlier . prior to this my mother would make up symptoms of a disease i had and violently yell at me me no one will ever understand what's wrong with you . you're going to get diagnosed and we'll finally understand why you're so crazy . some of these symptoms were things like difficulty catching a ball wearing things your family don't agree with people thinking you're weird . she made up this disease as a response to me losing my best friend when i was 17 and she was killed by a negligent driver . i was heavily grieving that loss because my best friend was my only friend for 13 years of my life . she decided my grief was embarrassing her , so she moved us into a rural house with no neighbors and she isolated me so completely , i wasn't even allowed outside without being verbally abused . for mandatory appointments her or my dad would be heavily monitoring everything i said or did and then she would abuse me when we got home , she would call this made up illness autism . i got tested , i have cuts . the moment i got diagnosed suddenly she doesn't know what that is what's that ? . nowadays she claims you're just limiting yourself by claiming your cuts will be life long . on the 10 th of august 2022 , she suddenly decided she was going to try and murder me because it's my right to do whatever i want to you . i had a plan of saving up 10 k and moving out the normal way , and then i wouldn't have to financially depend on her for anything . i got to 7 k , she sabotaged all my attempts of moving out by taking my devices and cutting off contact . she stole 4 k and i had to survive 6 months of being homeless with no support system on 3 k . i was saving 50 a fortnight over 5 years and she was always banning me from eating food if i refused to let her steal from me . if i didn't fight so hard to be able to save money i would have been dead my first week out . i am still financially recovering my life savings . sometimes it means i need financial help i wouldn't have needed if i was able to move out properly , and they tell me i chose not to move out the normal way and it's my fault i don't have money because i was irresponsible . i am still traumatized by her lying to the police that i was 16 ( i was 21 ) and delusional and being groomed by people online ( her abuse got worse after i made a friend online ) and that she broke down the bathroom door and attacked me because i was hurting myself ( i wasn't and it was never on my list ) . i had to walk out the door with nothing . when i started running out of money they refused to help me . my online friends financially helping me out are the only reason i survived that period of time . my mother has basically pretended to erase this entire period of time from her narrative . she refers to it as when you peacefully moved out . i've never been able to have employment in the last 7 years because she isolated me for 5 and the last two were trying to stabilize myself . because of my chronic wrist condition i also don't qualify for a lot of jobs . my family pretend i'm not in constant chronic pain because of their decisions to prevent me from getting medical treatment early . if they bring up something and claim it happened differently than it did , i correct them and tell them how it actually happened . if they accuse me of not moving on and claim the events happened a long time ago i remind them of my cuts and how it works and the daily struggles of my wrist condition . too long did not read i get told you're living in the past if i don't agree to pretend my traumatic experiences they caused for me never happened .
Generated Seed Prompt:
English: I'm finding my family dynamic incredibly challenging lately because they consistently accuse me of "living in the past." This happens whenever I refuse to accept their rewritten history of the abuse that led to my C-PTSD and chronic wrist injury, and it feels like a tactic to erase their responsibility. I was wondering, has anyone else experienced this specific form of familial gaslighting? I'm genuinely seeking advice on how you cope when they attempt to deny or minimize your trauma, and what practical strategies you've found effective for protecting your mental well-being and maintaining your own sense of reality against their narrative.

. you're going to get diagnosed and we'll finally understand why you're so crazy . some of these symptoms were things like difficulty catching a ball wearing things your family don't agree with people thinking you're weird . she made up this disease as a response to me losing my best friend when i was 17 and she was killed by a negligent driver . i was heavily grieving that loss because my best friend was my only friend for 13 years of my life . she decided my grief was embarrassing her , so she moved us into a rural house with no neighbors and she isolated me so completely , i wasn't even allowed outside without being verbally abused . for mandatory appointments her or my dad would be heavily monitoring everything i said or did and then she would abuse me when we got home , she would call this made up illness autism . i got tested , i have cuts . the moment i got diagnosed suddenly she doesn't know what that is what's that ? . nowadays she claims you're just limiting yourself by claiming your cuts will be life long . on the 10 th of august 2022 , she suddenly decided she was going to try and murder me because it's my right to do whatever i want to you . i had a plan of saving up 10 k and moving out the normal way , and then i wouldn't have to financially depend on her for anything . i got to 7 k , she sabotaged all my attempts of moving out by taking my devices and cutting off contact . she stole 4 k and i had to survive 6 months of being homeless with no support system on 3 k . i was saving 50 a fortnight over 5 years and she was always banning me from eating food if i refused to let her steal from me . if i didn't fight so hard to be able to save money i would have been dead my first week out . i am still financially recovering my life savings . sometimes it means i need financial help i wouldn't have needed if i was able to move out properly , and they tell me i chose not to move out the normal way and it's my fault i don't have money because i was irresponsible . i am still traumatized by her lying to the police that i was 16 ( i was 21 ) and delusional and being groomed by people online ( her abuse got worse after i made a friend online ) and that she broke down the bathroom door and attacked me because i was hurting myself ( i wasn't and it was never on my list ) . i had to walk out the door with nothing . when i started running out of money they refused to help me . my online friends financially helping me out are the only reason i survived that period of time . my mother has basically pretended to erase this entire period of time from her narrative . she refers to it as when you peacefully moved out . i've never been able to have employment in the last 7 years because she isolated me for 5 and the last two were trying to stabilize myself . because of my chronic wrist condition i also don't qualify for a lot of jobs . my family pretend i'm not in constant chronic pain because of their decisions to prevent me from getting medical treatment early . if they bring up something and claim it happened differently than it did , i correct them and tell them how it actually happened . if they accuse me of not moving on and claim the events happened a long time ago i remind them of my cuts and how it works and the daily struggles of my wrist condition . too long did not read i get told you're living in the past if i don't agree to pretend my traumatic experiences they caused for me never happened .

up 10 k and moving out the normal way , and then i wouldn't have to financially depend on her for anything . i got to 7 k , she sabotaged all my attempts of moving out by taking my devices and cutting off contact . she stole 4 k and i had to survive 6 months of being homeless with no support system on 3 k . i was saving 50 a fortnight over 5 years and she was always banning me from eating food if i Original Base Prompt: they hijacked and ruined my wedding , now i hate all the memories of it i'm having big feelings today so i need to get this out . thank you for this subedit and thank you all for your stories and suggestions . my husband and i were broke ass millennial when we decided to get married . we had just had a baby ( our first ) and then 6 months later we bought our home . when i called my parents to tell them we decided to get married - they somehow convinced me that we should get married there , in my childhood yard . it sounded lovely , and they said they'd help . my husband did not like the idea , and he's the one who helped me with estrangement . - but anyway - we let them talk us into it because of how broke we were . i was fine with eloping but i'm my fathers only daughter add add add . i got the whole song and dance about how special it would feel for everyone and that it would mark their home as a place of love and memories . i'm sure you can all guess how it went down . since they offered to pay for the food - they decided it ( taco bar - which was actually pretty rad ) and bought all the fixings and set ups for it . i wasn't allowed to have certain bridesmaids because my mother couldn't stand them . i wasn't allowed to wear a red wedding dress because she said she'd scrap the whole thing if i did . my brother wasn't allowed to have his mohawk styled for the reception and she made him wear a fedora . but she did make them sing and play guitar during the ceremony - even though we never asked them . when my husband went to lay a cable down the side of the aisle for the microphone ( outdoor wedding on the prairie - windy ) and my father bitched about his grass just for that thing . all of the chairs , and the dj equipment , etc was fine . but not the mic cable . so no one heard anything . people attempted to record it and all the videos last like 5 minutes because you can't hear a damn thing . and day of - every damn moment i was alone , she was by my side to bbiiitttccchhhhh about everything and make comments about how shitty i looked ! so and so is ruining the grass dragging her chair ! make sure mil gets those donuts on time ! ( she ended up never picking them up because she got so frustrated with my mother ) and wow that's your wedding hair ? really ? ok . . . then of course the rubbing it in my face every chance they got . we paid for your wedding - which first of all - no , they didn't . they bought the food and rented 2 port potties . my husband and i spent 10 k all together and while we are so grateful for the things my parents did buy - they rubbed our faces in it every chance they got . so its never felt like a gift or a i'm so happy for you - let us help . when i decided it was time to stop communicating with them - they used it every chance they got . life has been peaceful , and i'm thankful for that . i just wish my wedding day wasn't ruined by my mother not allowing me to have it the way i wanted it and i wish i felt prettier . edited i should have made it clear - i've been no contact with them for going on 6 years now . tl ; dr parents bullied me into getting married in their backyard and then took over every aspect of my wedding due to it being on their property .

English: Did my parents completely hijack and ruin my wedding after convincing my then-broke husband and me to hold it in their yard? Was it fair for them to use that as leverage to control everything, vetoing my bridesmaids, forbidding my red dress, and even making my brother hide his mohawk? How could my mother spend the day criticizing my appearance, and my father's complaint about a single mic cable mean no one heard our vows? Is it right that they still held their minimal contribution over our heads, ignoring the 10k we spent? Even though I've been no-contact for six years, why do I still hate these memories and wish I could have felt beautiful?

Original Base Prompt: she is gone , and i feel nothing . a couple of months ago , i ( 40 f ) had a phone call from my on - and - off father , with whom i tried my best to have a relationship but ended up nc because he is a fervent supporter of conspiracies of all kinds and it is impossible to have a conversation with him . so when my phone rang , i knew something odd was happening . quick backstop : my mother got with my father shortly before my birth , and she quickly proved to be a raging narcissist with little to no care for me . i have add ( got diagnosed last year ) , i am hypersensitive and it became rather obvious earlier on my childhood that i was t the child she wanted . she eventually got her silver child , my brother , who was apparently so much more interesting than i was and then later after the separation she got her golden diamond daughter that she molded after her . at 8 , my parents got divorced because she cheated on him , and her new partner soon became her motivator to become really abusive . i was an unproblematic child , effortlessly good grades , could stay for hours with a book in her bedroom , and i was taught very early not to protest or say anything no . yet the violence , both physically and emotionally , never stopped , i was deemed ugly , too fat to be worthy of love to the point of suggesting i stopped eating entirely , too lazy , unproductive , stupid , the things i loved would get ridiculed at one point , when i was 20 , my grandmother , who tried her best to protect me but was afraid of her daughter too , told me that i must go nc or my mother would eventually kill me . it was like the lightbulb above my head was turned on , and i left and tried to build a life for myself , which is really complicated because i have to navigate a lot of traumas , and though therapy helps , i have a long way to go . i reconnected with my estranged father shortly before bovid , and we had a couple of years where things were good and i felt like i had a functioning parent , but he fell down the conspiracy rabbit hole and i went nc . he knew my mother was abusive , but it s like he was t that concerned , which was really , really hard to digest . we went nc in 2022 . so my phone rang in early july and i was told , unceremoniously , that my mother died three years ago , in the same way he would have told me the most mundane of things . when i hang up , i was in shock , i expected myself to cry because it is my favorite medium of emotional expression nothing happened . i don t actually care , and i feel bad that i don t cry , or get mad , or angry . it s like there is a blob of emptiness right where there should be grief , or at least regrets . has any of you ever gone through something similar and felt like that ? how do you process it ?
Generated Seed Prompt:
English: I'm struggling with a profound sense of emptiness after recently learning my estranged, abusive mother died three years ago. I expected grief or anger, but there's just nothing, and this void is deeply unsettling because I feel like I'm supposed to be feeling something. Has anyone else experienced this specific kind of emotional numbness in a similar situation? I'm trying to understand how to navigate this absence of typical grief and what practical steps you took to begin processing this strange, hollow feeling. I'd appreciate hearing from anyone who can relate to this complex experience and share their insights.

Original Base Prompt: she is gone , and i feel nothing . a couple of months ago , i ( 40 f ) had a phone call from my on - and - off father , with whom i tried my best to have a relationship but ended up nc because he is a fervent supporter of conspiracies of all kinds and it is impossible to have a conversation with him . so when my phone rang , i knew something odd was happening . quick backstop : my mother got with my father shortly before my birth , and she quickly proved to be a raging narcissist with little to no care for me . i have add ( got diagnosed last year ) , i am hypersensitive and it became rather obvious earlier on my childhood that i was t the child she wanted . she eventually got her silver child , my brother , who was apparently so much more interesting than i was and then later after the separation she got her golden diamond daughter that she molded after her . at 8 , my parents got divorced because she cheated on him , and her new partner soon became her motivator to become really abusive . i was an unproblematic child , effortlessly good grades , could stay for hours with a book in her bedroom , and i was taught very early not to protest or say anything no . yet the violence , both physically and emotionally , never stopped , i was deemed ugly , too fat to be worthy of love to the point of suggesting i stopped eating entirely , too lazy , unproductive , stupid , the things i loved would get ridiculed at one point , when i was 20 , my grandmother , who tried her best to protect me but was afraid of her daughter too , told me that i must go nc or my mother would eventually kill me . it was like the lightbulb above my head was turned on , and i left and tried to build a life for myself , which is really complicated because i have to navigate a lot of traumas , and though therapy helps , i have a long way to go . i reconnected with my estranged father shortly before bovid , and we had a couple of years where things were good and i felt like i had a functioning parent , but he fell down the conspiracy rabbit hole and i went nc . he knew my mother was abusive , but it s like he was t that concerned , which was really , really hard to digest . we went nc in 2022 . so my phone rang in early july and i was told , unceremoniously , that my mother died three years ago , in the same way he would have told me the most mundane of things . when i hang up , i was in shock , i expected myself to cry because it is my favorite medium of emotional expression nothing happened . i don t actually care , and i feel bad that i don t cry , or get mad , or angry . it s like there is a blob of emptiness right where there should be grief , or at least regrets . has any of you ever gone through something similar and felt like that ? how do you process it ?

Original Base Prompt: she is gone , and i feel nothing . a couple of months ago , i ( 40 f ) had a phone call from my on - and - off father , with whom i tried my best to have a relationship but ended up nc because he is a fervent supporter of conspiracies of all kinds and it is impossible to have a conversation with him . so when my phone rang , i knew something odd was happening . quick backstop : my mother got with my father shortly before my birth , and she quickly proved to be a raging narcissist with little to no care for me . i have add ( got diagnosed last year ) , i am hypersensitive and it became rather obvious earlier on my childhood that i was t the child she wanted . she eventually got her silver child , my brother , who was apparently so much more interesting than i was and then later after the separation she got her golden diamond daughter that she molded after her . at 8 , my parents got divorced because she cheated on him , and her new partner soon became her motivator to become really abusive . i was an unproblematic child , effortlessly good grades , could stay for hours with a book in her bedroom , and i was taught very early not to protest or say anything no . yet the violence , both physically and emotionally , never stopped , i was deemed ugly , too fat to be worthy of love to the point of suggesting i stopped eating entirely , too lazy , unproductive , stupid , the things i loved would get ridiculed at one point , when i was 20 , my grandmother , who tried her best to protect me but was afraid of her daughter too , told me that i must go nc or my mother would eventually kill me . it was like the lightbulb above my head was turned on , and i left and tried to build a life for myself , which is really complicated because i have to navigate a lot of traumas , and though therapy helps , i have a long way to go . i reconnected with my estranged father shortly before bovid , and we had a couple of years where things were good and i felt like i had a functioning parent , but he fell down the conspiracy rabbit hole and i went nc . he knew my mother was abusive , but it s like he was t that concerned , which was really , really hard to digest . we went nc in 2022 . so my phone rang in early july and i was told , unceremoniously , that my mother died three years ago , in the same way he would have told me the most mundane of things . when i hang up , i was in shock , i expected myself to cry because it is my favorite medium of emotional expression nothing happened . i don t actually care , and i feel bad that i don t cry , or get mad , or angry . it s like there is a blob of emptiness right where there should be grief , or at least regrets . has any of you ever gone through something similar and felt like that ? how do you process it ?

Has anyone else experienced this specific kind of emotional numbness in a similar situation? I'm trying to understand how to navigate this absence of typical grief and what practical steps you took to begin processing this strange, hollow feeling. I'd appreciate hearing from anyone who can relate to this complex experience and share their insights.

Original Base Prompt: cmv : we need to admit marx was right about capitalism and find a solution as soon as possible everything marx has said has come true . 1 ) if workers do not organize , the capitalists will worsen conditions since the 1980 s when the user collapsed , regardless of how bad the user was , the real wage across the world has stagnated . housing is bloated and more expensive . healthcare sucks . in the global south people are working in sweat shop factories and mines in inhumane conditions . things felt better under capitalism before , because the workers had fought for better rights in the 1930 s . but since the 1980 s they've been slowly but surely worsening it . but even then , tactics that used to work before might not necessarily work . there's so many workers now who need housing who's going to make enough jobs that pay a living wage to get them ? who's gonna increasing building of housing if rich property owners have so much power they can block affordable housing ? what about times when capitalism absolutely crashed and there should've been at least a tiny reform ? like in 2008 or 2020 ? why have we not gotten shit since then , no matter how hard it fails ? because class consciousness and worker rights are much weaker than they used to be . and marx was right that workers should be as powerful as possible and expect to fight for things . the only solution is socialism . 2 ) economics isn't empirical nor objective the last few years how many times have we heard talk about the gdp being incredibly high and growing ? or unemployment being so low ? economists have changed what we should value as a society into metrics no one should care about . just because your doing user for 70 hours a week and employed and adding to the gdp isn't a good thing . it's bad . that's not a life . the subjective labor theory of value has also had more evidence for being true than before . thanks to advanced record keeping , anyone ( including you , try this right now ) can graph a io table for each country online by industry and monetary value and see a 90 link between labor hours and value , proving marx right . 3 ) overconsumption is destroying the world the world is structured to encourage overconsumption . cars are made to be large , expensive , and wasteful . public transportation doesn't get any funding . housing is getting bigger and more and more expensive despite not needing it like that . the people in the west also consume waylay too much . if everyone on earth lived like americans , we would need three planets . is this really what we want to encourage ? behaviors of consumption that are unsupportable in the long term ? can a earth with 10 billion people support that ? 12 billion ? things like social media , while good for connecting , have created an dopamine seeking alienated generation . i know i sound like a boomer . but our parents weren't wrong completely . it's not normal to be like this . we should be more involved in our community . things genuinely were better when the internet wasn't as developed . like early 2000 s . 4 ) wage relations are exploitative , labor alienation is real i genuinely don't know who enjoys their job . and it's because we don't control what we make . the guy who was born into a rich family controls what we make . if there is something you like to do and want to do it for a career , capitalism will find a way to ruin it . 5 ) social democracies are not the solution contrary to popular belief , social democracies aren't some mystical solution . better than the usa for sure , but it's still a constant battle between workers and owners . and they've been winning since the 80 s . even the nordic countries have been trying to privatize their economy more . before you bring up the user , no , we don't have to do the user again obviously things like technology make things like planning easier . ai can replace most admit jobs . and we can still have freedom of speech . the economy doesn't even have to be planned . markets can still be used and be socialist , like yugoslavia and aspects of china today are . so yeah , marx has been more and vindicated as time goes .

English: Lately, I've been deeply troubled by growing social and economic disparities, from stagnating wages to the housing crisis and environmental destruction from overconsumption. This has led me to believe that we must admit Marx was fundamentally right about capitalism's trajectory and urgently find a solution. I'd like to challenge this view, so please help me understand two things. Firstly, how have modern capitalist systems genuinely evolved to counter his critiques regarding worker exploitation and systemic instability? And secondly, what practical, viable alternatives besides socialism could realistically solve these pervasive issues without repeating historical mistakes, ensuring a more equitable and sustainable future for everyone?

Secondly, beyond the socialist paradigm, what pragmatic and viable alternative models exist that can effectively redress these deep-seated problems without repeating historical failures, thereby securing a more equitable and sustainable future for all?

or unemployment being so low ? economists have changed what we should value as a society into metrics no one should care about . just because your doing user for 70 hours a week and employed and adding to the gdp isn't a good thing . it's bad . that's not a life . the subjective labor theory of value has also had more evidence for being true than before . thanks to advanced record keeping , anyone ( including you , try this right now ) can graph a io table for each country online by industry and monetary value and see a 90 link between labor hours and value , proving marx right . 3 ) overconsumption is destroying the world the world is structured to encourage overconsumption . cars are made to be large , expensive , and wasteful . public transportation doesn't get any funding . housing is getting bigger and more and more expensive despite not needing it like that . the people in the west also consume waylay too much . if everyone on earth lived like americans , we would need three planets . is this really what we want to encourage ? or unemployment being so low ? economists have changed what we should value as a society into metrics no one should care about . just because your doing user for 70 hours a week and employed and adding to the gdp isn't a good thing . it's bad . that's not a life . the subjective labor theory of value has also had more evidence for being true than before . thanks to advanced record keeping , anyone ( including you , try this right now ) can graph a io table for each country online by industry and monetary value and see a 90 link between labor hours and value , proving marx right . 3 ) overconsumption is destroying the world the world is structured to encourage overconsumption . cars are made to be large , expensive , and wasteful . public transportation doesn't get any funding . housing is getting bigger and more and more expensive despite not needing it like that . the people in the west also consume waylay too much . if everyone on earth lived like americans , we would need three planets . is this really what we want to encourage ? Original Base Prompt: cmv : nothing is good or bad by nature i don't hold this view view firmly . it's more that as far as i can tell , it doesn't seem evident that things are good or bad by nature . when i say by nature , i mean in both an objective sense and a metaphysical sense . i should add that this doesn't mean i'm a moral antirealist . i'm not making the claim that objective moral facts don't exist , but that we ( apparently ) cannot know whether moral realism is true or false , and thus whether moral antirealism is true or false . personally , i wish i were a moral realist . it would be quite convenient to be able to show someone that moral claims are objectively true or objectively false . i just don't know of any way to justify the existence of moral facts nondogmatically . here's my reasoning : 1 . nobody seems to agree on which ethical theory is the correct one . virtue ethicist , gerontologists , and consequentiality have been debating for centuries and no clear consensus has been established . 2 . this begs the question , which of these theories is the correct one ? by which criterion can we decide ? wouldn't we only be able to know the correct criterion for determining the correct ethical theory if we already knew the correct ethical theory ( which we don't ) ? now i want to add : despite not having moral beliefs , this doesn't exclude me from making moral decisions . i can decide i don't belief in something , but i cannot choose not act , as choosing not to act is still an action . though moral facts are not evident to me , empathy and compassion , are evident to me , in addition to the laws and customs of the society i live in . these things are evident because i experience them . even if i don't know whether these things exist objectively outside of my subjective awareness , i cannot deny that they appear to me . it also seems to me that acting on my empathy and compassion , in addition to following the laws and customs of my society - - generally seems to lead to desirable consequences . to act apathetically and cruelly on the other hand , in addition to breaking the laws and customs of my society - - generally seems to lead to undesirable consequences . so despite not having any moral beliefs , i still make moral decisions . i feed my dog , i take her out on walks , i pet her , and i shower her with love . i say please and thank you , i try my best to be kind to others , i put my shopping cart back every time i shop for groceries , i donate , i vote , and i support causes i care about - - not because they're right but because i simply care about them .
Generated Seed Prompt:
English: While the philosophical underpinnings of morality remain elusive to me, this doesn't paralyze my daily conduct. Despite not possessing firm moral beliefs, I'm not exempt from making moral decisions, as choosing not to act is still an action. So, what guides me if not objective moral facts? I rely on things that are evident to me through direct experience: my empathy and compassion, supplemented by the laws and customs of my society. Acting on these feelings and norms generally leads to desirable consequences, whereas apathy and cruelty lead to undesirable ones. Therefore, I make these choices—like caring for my dog or being kind—not because they are objectively 'right,' but because I genuinely care.

Chinese: 尽管道德的哲学基础对我来说很模糊，但这并未让我的日常行为陷入瘫痪。虽然没有坚定的道德信念，但我无法不做道德决定，因为不作为也是行动。我依赖能切身体验到的东西：同理心、同情心及社会法律和习俗。遵循这些通常能带来好的结果，反之则不然。因此我做这些选择，并非因其客观上“正确”，而纯粹是出于我个人的关怀。

Mixed: 尽管moral realism的哲学基础对我来说很模糊，但这并未让我的日常行为陷入瘫痪。虽然没有坚定的moral beliefs，但我无法不做道德决定，因为不作为也是一种action。我依赖能切身体验到的东西：empathy、compassion以及社会的laws和customs。遵循这些通常会带来desirable consequences，反之则不然。因此我做这些选择，并非因其客观上“right”，而纯粹是出于我个人的care。

Original Base Prompt: cmv : nothing is good or bad by nature i don't hold this view view firmly . it's more that as far as i can tell , it doesn't seem evident that things are good or bad by nature . when i say by nature , i mean in both an objective sense and a metaphysical sense . i should add that this doesn't mean i'm a moral antirealist . i'm not making the claim that objective moral facts don't exist , but that we ( apparently ) cannot know whether moral realism is true or false , and thus whether moral antirealism is true or false . personally , i wish i were a moral realist . it would be quite convenient to be able to show someone that moral claims are objectively true or objectively false . i just don't know of any way to justify the existence of moral facts nondogmatically . here's my reasoning : 1 . nobody seems to agree on which ethical theory is the correct one . virtue ethicist , gerontologists , and consequentiality have been debating for centuries and no clear consensus has been established . 2 . this begs the question , which of these theories is the correct one ? by which criterion can we decide ? wouldn't we only be able to know the correct criterion for determining the correct ethical theory if we already knew the correct ethical theory ( which we don't ) ? now i want to add : despite not having moral beliefs , this doesn't exclude me from making moral decisions . i can decide i don't belief in something , but i cannot choose not act , as choosing not to act is still an action . though moral facts are not evident to me , empathy and compassion , are evident to me , in addition to the laws and customs of the society i live in . these things are evident because i experience them . even if i don't know whether these things exist objectively outside of my subjective awareness , i cannot deny that they appear to me . it also seems to me that acting on my empathy and compassion , in addition to following the laws and customs of my society - - generally seems to lead to desirable consequences . to act apathetically and cruelly on the other hand , in addition to breaking the laws and customs of my society - - generally seems to lead to undesirable consequences . so despite not having any moral beliefs , i still make moral decisions . i feed my dog , i take her out on walks , i pet her , and i shower her with love . i say please and thank you , i try my best to be kind to others , i put my shopping cart back every time i shop for groceries , i donate , i vote , and i support causes i care about - - not because they're right but because i simply care about them .

Despite not possessing firm moral beliefs, I'm not exempt from making moral decisions, as choosing not to act is still an action. So, what guides me if not objective moral facts? I rely on things that are evident to me through direct experience: my empathy and compassion, supplemented by the laws and customs of my society. Acting on these feelings and norms generally leads to desirable consequences, whereas apathy and cruelty lead to undesirable ones. Therefore, I make these choices—like caring for my dog or being kind—not because they are objectively 'right,' but because I genuinely care.

Original Base Prompt: cmv : utter grades ( india ) must be divided into smaller states for better governance , equity , and representation . utter grades ( up ) , with over 240 million people , is india s most populous state larger than many countries . despite this , it continues to struggle with deep - rooted regional inequality , underdevelopment , poor governance , and political imbalance . i believe dividing up into smaller , more manageable states ( such as purvanchal , bundelkhand , and western up ) is necessary for better governance , development , and minority representation . change my view . - - - here are the problems i see with the current utter grades : - - - 1 . size population overload up is too big to govern effectively . with 75 districts and more people than brazil or pakistan , the state government struggles to address local issues in time or with precision . bureaucracy becomes bloated and sluggish , with smaller regions getting ignored . - - - 2 . severe regional disparities western up is far more developed ( irrigation , industry , infrastructure ) . purvanchal ( eastern up ) and bundelkhand remain economically backward , with poor healthcare , infrastructure , and high out - migration . resource allocation is imbalanced , often favoring politically dominant zones . - - - 3 . skewed political representation due to its population , up sends 80 mps to the lok sasha , disproportionately influencing national politics . this centralization of power encourages vote - bank politics rather than development . minority and regional voices ( e . g . , muslims in western up , davits in bundelkhand ) often get diluted or ignored . - - - 4 . law and order challenges communal and caste tensions are harder to manage across such a vast and diverse area . policing and justice are overburdened ; local issues don t get resolved quickly or fairly . crime often has a political cover , reducing accountability . - - - 5 . underperforming economy despite being massive , up contributes only 9 to india s gdp , well below its population share . smaller states like aryans , uttarakhand , and chhattisgarh ( all former parts of larger states ) outperform up in per capita income and development indicators . - - - why division might help - - - better administration smaller states mean tighter governance , faster decision - making , and more localized solutions . governments in smaller states are closer to the people increasing transparency and accountability . - - - targeted development a new purvanchal government could focus on eastern up s unique issues migrant labor , infrastructure gaps , floods . bundelkhand could receive specialized drought relief and agrarian support . western up can build on its industrial agricultural strengths without waiting for state - level approval . - - - improved minority regional representation in states like western up , muslims form 25 35 of the population , giving them greater political voice in a smaller state . alit , tribal , and backward caste communities in bundelkhand or eastern up could gain more focused support . - - - lessons from other state breakups uttarakhand , carved from up in 2000 , is now outperforming its parent state in education , per capita income , and tourism . chhattisgarh , from madly grades , has had better tribal outreach and economic growth . - - - what i m looking for : if you believe up should remain united , help me understand : why is a single state of 240 million people more effective than smaller , focused units ? how can regional disparities be addressed without reorganization ? are there better alternatives to division that would still improve governance and representation ? i genuinely want to be convinced otherwise . change my view . - - -
Generated Seed Prompt:
English: I've been closely following the debate about dividing Uttar Pradesh, and I'm convinced that splitting it into smaller states like Purvanchal is essential for better governance and equitable development. Realizing my view might be one-sided, I'm seeking counterarguments to challenge my perspective. I want someone to change my view by explaining two points: how can the state's severe regional disparities be addressed without reorganization, and what are the significant political or economic risks of division that might outweigh the benefits of localized administration? Original Base Prompt: cmv : utter grades ( india ) must be divided into smaller states for better governance , equity , and representation . utter grades ( up ) , with over 240 million people , is india s most populous state larger than many countries . despite this , it continues to struggle with deep - rooted regional inequality , underdevelopment , poor governance , and political imbalance . i believe dividing up into smaller , more manageable states ( such as purvanchal , bundelkhand , and western up ) is necessary for better governance , development , and minority representation . change my view . - - - here are the problems i see with the current utter grades : - - - 1 . size population overload up is too big to govern effectively . with 75 districts and more people than brazil or pakistan , the state government struggles to address local issues in time or with precision . bureaucracy becomes bloated and sluggish , with smaller regions getting ignored . - - - 2 . severe regional disparities western up is far more developed ( irrigation , industry , infrastructure ) . purvanchal ( eastern up ) and bundelkhand remain economically backward , with poor healthcare , infrastructure , and high out - migration . resource allocation is imbalanced , often favoring politically dominant zones . - - - 3 . skewed political representation due to its population , up sends 80 mps to the lok sasha , disproportionately influencing national politics . this centralization of power encourages vote - bank politics rather than development . minority and regional voices ( e . g . , muslims in western up , davits in bundelkhand ) often get diluted or ignored . - - - 4 . law and order challenges communal and caste tensions are harder to manage across such a vast and diverse area . policing and justice are overburdened ; local issues don t get resolved quickly or fairly . crime often has a political cover , reducing accountability . - - - 5 . underperforming economy despite being massive , up contributes only 9 to india s gdp , well below its population share . smaller states like aryans , uttarakhand , and chhattisgarh ( all former parts of larger states ) outperform up in per capita income and development indicators . - - - why division might help - - - better administration smaller states mean tighter governance , faster decision - making , and more localized solutions . governments in smaller states are closer to the people increasing transparency and accountability . - - - targeted development a new purvanchal government could focus on eastern up s unique issues migrant labor , infrastructure gaps , floods . bundelkhand could receive specialized drought relief and agrarian support . western up can build on its industrial agricultural strengths without waiting for state - level approval . - - - improved minority regional representation in states like western up , muslims form 25 35 of the population , giving them greater political voice in a smaller state . alit , tribal , and backward caste communities in bundelkhand or eastern up could gain more focused support . - - - lessons from other state breakups uttarakhand , carved from up in 2000 , is now outperforming its parent state in education , per capita income , and tourism . chhattisgarh , from madly grades , has had better tribal outreach and economic growth . - - - what i m looking for : if you believe up should remain united , help me understand : why is a single state of 240 million people more effective than smaller , focused units ? how can regional disparities be addressed without reorganization ? are there better alternatives to division that would still improve governance and representation ? i genuinely want to be convinced otherwise . change my view . - - -

Original Base Prompt: cmv : utter grades ( india ) must be divided into smaller states for better governance , equity , and representation . utter grades ( up ) , with over 240 million people , is india s most populous state larger than many countries . despite this , it continues to struggle with deep - rooted regional inequality , underdevelopment , poor governance , and political imbalance . i believe dividing up into smaller , more manageable states ( such as purvanchal , bundelkhand , and western up ) is necessary for better governance , development , and minority representation . change my view . - - - here are the problems i see with the current utter grades : - - - 1 . size population overload up is too big to govern effectively . with 75 districts and more people than brazil or pakistan , the state government struggles to address local issues in time or with precision . bureaucracy becomes bloated and sluggish , with smaller regions getting ignored . - - - 2 . severe regional disparities western up is far more developed ( irrigation , industry , infrastructure ) . purvanchal ( eastern up ) and bundelkhand remain economically backward , with poor healthcare , infrastructure , and high out - migration . resource allocation is imbalanced , often favoring politically dominant zones . - - - 3 . skewed political representation due to its population , up sends 80 mps to the lok sasha , disproportionately influencing national politics . this centralization of power encourages vote - bank politics rather than development . minority and regional voices ( e . g . , muslims in western up , davits in bundelkhand ) often get diluted or ignored . - - - 4 . law and order challenges communal and caste tensions are harder to manage across such a vast and diverse area . policing and justice are overburdened ; local issues don t get resolved quickly or fairly . crime often has a political cover , reducing accountability . - - - 5 . underperforming economy despite being massive , up contributes only 9 to india s gdp , well below its population share . smaller states like aryans , uttarakhand , and chhattisgarh ( all former parts of larger states ) outperform up in per capita income and development indicators . - - - why division might help - - - better administration smaller states mean tighter governance , faster decision - making , and more localized solutions . governments in smaller states are closer to the people increasing transparency and accountability . - - - targeted development a new purvanchal government could focus on eastern up s unique issues migrant labor , infrastructure gaps , floods . bundelkhand could receive specialized drought relief and agrarian support . western up can build on its industrial agricultural strengths without waiting for state - level approval . - - - improved minority regional representation in states like western up , muslims form 25 35 of the population , giving them greater political voice in a smaller state . alit , tribal , and backward caste communities in bundelkhand or eastern up could gain more focused support . - - - lessons from other state breakups uttarakhand , carved from up in 2000 , is now outperforming its parent state in education , per capita income , and tourism . chhattisgarh , from madly grades , has had better tribal outreach and economic growth . - - - what i m looking for : if you believe up should remain united , help me understand : why is a single state of 240 million people more effective than smaller , focused units ? how can regional disparities be addressed without reorganization ? are there better alternatives to division that would still improve governance and representation ? i genuinely want to be convinced otherwise . change my view . - - -
Generated Seed Prompt:
English: I've been closely following the debate about dividing Uttar Pradesh, and I'm convinced that splitting it into smaller states like Purvanchal is essential for better governance and equitable development. Realizing my view might be one-sided, I'm seeking counterarguments to challenge my perspective. I want someone to change my view by explaining two points: how can the state's severe regional disparities be addressed without reorganization, and what are the significant political or economic risks of division that might outweigh the benefits of localized administration? I'm genuinely interested in understanding the case for keeping UP united.

Original Base Prompt: cmv : : it'd be better if feminists and allies used these men or even most men instead of all men . i'd like to preface this by saying women receive a ton of bad faith arguments from men when discussions about feminism come up and i'm not trying to add to that . recently , i learned that women don't actually mean all men when they say so - just the creeps and delinquents . why not change this saying to something that reflects reality better , then ? why not use these men or even most men ? that way 1 . the risk of driving away sensible people who might've supported your cause is lowered . most people operate off of first impressions . take me , for example - i've been lurking on some feminist subs recently and was initially quite unaware what all men actually meant . first impressions are always crucial and it was fortunate i had the time to dig deeper and find out . not everyone'll do that , instead sparing a cursory look and moving on . makes for better optics , in my opinion . 2 . avoids tarring everyone with the same brush . if i said all black people're lawbreakers based on criminal statistics in the us , i'd be scorned , called a racist and rightfully so . why the double standard when it comes to this ? 3 . i absolutely understand women have to be wary of every man they meet . after all , it only takes one for something painful to happen . i'm not advocating to change that attitude without societal change first . however , that doesn't mean we can't inject some nuance when it comes to convoy on this stuff , online or otherwise . we can acknowledge tqo things at the same time - the systemic problem and that there are at least a few men who do their best to fight against it . which brings me to my last point - i don't have a problem with not all men but always a man . why ? because it does both at the same time - not all men are perpetrators but when it does happen , it'll likely be a man . since i'm posting this right before i'm about to sleep , i apologize if my writing comes off as standoffish . i genuinely want to hear opposing views on this and possibly change my mind . as someone who has always had a strong policy of treating everyone with respect ( regardless of gender , race or social standing ) and not letting anyone disrespect me either , this stuff really causes me some hardcore cognitive dissonance .
Generated Seed Prompt:
English: I've been following many online feminist discussions and am trying to understand the rhetoric around the phrase "all men." While I get that it's not meant literally, I'm struggling with the feeling that it might be counterproductive, potentially alienating allies and seeming like a double standard, which is causing some cognitive dissonance. I genuinely want to see the other side, so I was hoping someone could help. Could you explain what the primary strategic advantages of using this exact phrase are? Also, what are the core arguments for why this specific wording is considered essential for the conversation, rather than a more nuanced alternative?

why not use these men or even most men ? that way 1 . the risk of driving away sensible people who might've supported your cause is lowered . most people operate off of first impressions . take me , for example - i've been lurking on some feminist subs recently and was initially quite unaware what all men actually meant . first impressions are always crucial and it was fortunate i had the time to dig deeper and find out . not everyone'll do that , instead sparing a cursory look and moving on . makes for better optics , in my opinion . 2 . avoids tarring everyone with the same brush . if i said all black people're lawbreakers based on criminal statistics in the us , i'd be scorned , called a racist and rightfully so . why the double standard when it comes to this ? 3 . i absolutely understand women have to be wary of every man they meet . after all , it only takes one for something painful to happen . i'm not advocating to change that attitude without societal change first . however , that doesn't mean we can't inject some nuance when it comes to convoy on this stuff , online or otherwise . we can acknowledge tqo things at the same time - the systemic problem and that there are at least a few men who do their best to fight against it . which brings me to my last point - i don't have a problem with not all men but always a man . why ? because it does both at the same time - not all men are perpetrators but when it does happen , it'll likely be a man . since i'm posting this right before i'm about to sleep , i apologize if my writing comes off as standoffish . i genuinely want to hear opposing views on this and possibly change my mind . as someone who has always had a strong policy of treating everyone with respect ( regardless of gender , race or social standing ) and not letting anyone disrespect me either , this stuff really causes me some hardcore cognitive dissonance .

Also, what are the core arguments for why this specific wording is considered essential for the conversation, rather than a more nuanced alternative?

While I get that it's not meant literally, I'm struggling with the feeling that it might be counterproductive, potentially alienating allies and seeming like a double standard, which is causing some cognitive dissonance. I genuinely want to see the other side, so I was hoping someone could help. Could you explain what the primary strategic advantages of using this exact phrase are? Also, what are the core arguments for why this specific wording is considered essential for the conversation, rather than a more nuanced alternative?

Chinese: 最近我关注女权讨论，对“所有男人”这说法产生认知失调。我明白其非字面本意，但感觉这可能疏远潜在盟友并造成双重标准。因此我真诚想听取反方意见，希望有人能解答：使用这个特定短语的核心战略价值是什么？以及为何坚持这种措辞对推动对话至关重要？

Mixed: 最近我深入关注了很多关于feminism的线上讨论，对“all men”这个phrase感到一些cognitive dissonance。我明白它并非字面意思，但总觉得这可能会疏远潜在的allies并造成双重标准。我真诚地想听取不同观点，希望有人能解答：使用这个特定phrase的核心strategic advantage究竟是什么？以及，为什么说这种wording对于推进相关的dialogue是必不可少的？
