Original Base Prompt: how do i deal with my mama family ? let me preface this by saying that i love my family very much . my family is pretty large and close knit and they ve given me nothing but love and support my entire life . however , i cannot stand their political views and have been coming to terms with the reality that outside of the love they give to me and other family members , they simply are not good people . it s deeper than politics . it s the way they view the world and treat others . throughout my life , they have always been conservative but they used to at least have principles . i remember they could t stand trump and thought he was a joke at first . however , once he was the republican nominee in 2016 , they all fell in line and voted for him . since then , they ve become more and more radicalized and brainwashed and are now huge trump supporters and conspiracy theorists . they believe everything that comes out of his mouth . it s been beyond heartbreaking to watch the people i loved so dearly slowly descend into madness , paranoia , and rage . most of them do a good job about avoiding political discussions around me since they know i m on the other end of the political spectrum , but others seem to not care about my feelings at all and just rattle off whatever talking points fox news is feeding them at that moment . and i can obviously still see all of the insane things they post on facebook . it s been especially bad ever since charlie kirk was shot . it s like they re all suffering from mass psychosis and yet i feel like the crazy one since i m always the odd man out . i m in my 20 s and live on my own and can obviously limit my interactions with them but i still feel obligated to go visit them pretty regularly and will also be around them for thanksgiving and christmas . how do i grapple with this ? Original Base Prompt: my mil literally just ostracized me from the entire family due to politics and i am legitimately shook cw : childhood abuse and childhood sa my husband and i are left leaning . my husband's family ( a good 90 of them ) are deep red trump fans . these last 2 weeks have obviously been wild . ever since the kirk thing , they have gone mad on facebook consistently posting far right leaning shit . all the time . and you know what ? that is fine . i have not commented on any of those posts , i have not interacted with any of those posts . i do not call them out or anything because i know it is a losing battle . i know how to follow and how to ignore . i typically do not post politics myself . admitting , these last 2 weeks have been different . i want to make it clear , i am not posting anything that calls mama and trump supporters evil , monsters , nothing like that . literally my post that started this entire debacle was the countries where comedians can't mock the leader on late night tv are not countries you want to live in and my caption was i am glad george carlin is not alive today . george carlin would get cancelled . that was literally it . no comments about mama or trump supporters or anything in comes psycho mil . i want to point out that she has commented on nearly every single one of my political posts , and even got into a huge political fight with my own step mom . and you know what ? i did not interact with any of them . didn't acknowledge , just ignored it and let her say what she wanted . admitting , the stupid jimmy k眉mmel shit really kind of set me off and this was the very very very first time i actually replied back to her political bantering . i want to make clear now that my husband when trump won in 2024 gave me free reign to respond to any of his family who may come at me about politics . and i want to make it very clear that this was the single only time i responded . and it blew . the . fuck . up . she goes on about how many people got cancelled , trump included . i rebutted with the trump tweet saying k眉mmel would get fired months before , along with what the fcc said right before abc removed k眉mmel . she then asked me to maybe not post about politics for a month . and i want to stop here . before charlie kirk , i did not post about politics at all . since charlie kirk . i made maybe 6 posts all together in the span of 2 weeks . and they were just simple shared posts such as trump's video saying he does not care to unify the country . all the while her family and her have been posting all this weird charlie kirk shit like all those weird ass ai videos of jesus taking him to heaven and shit . which . i never comment or engage with . so she tells me maybe not to post about politics for a month because she sees my views and these posts ( my late night talk show post ) as dividing the family . this chick literally said my very benign posts were dividing the family while her entire fucking side posts all day every day pro conservative shit that i never engage with . like that doesn't divide the family . anyway , long story short , she started messaging my husband saying it is clear that i am obsessed and filled with hate . then , her and my husband have a huge back and forth where he is defending me and she is going off . then she adds my husband and i both in a message group saying that she felt attacked for her vote for trump and that we are family and should stick together . like ? ? ? ? i told her you just told my husband that i am filled with hate and that i am obsessed , and you told me that i am dividing the family . how can you sit here and talk about family unity when you just said that to me ? i never insulted you , never insulted your character and never criticized your vote . you are more mad at me speaking my mind over the president who specifically said he does not care to unify the country . then she said that i am clearly not ready for an apology and she will leave it at that . ok , whatever . . . later that night , her sister ( my husband's aunt ) also deleted me and also removed my invite for thanksgiving . cool , so now i am suddenly not invited to thanksgiving . then , this started to stress out my husband who started yelling at me because he said that i should have came to him before i ever responded to his mom and even though what i posted was not horrible or insulting at all that he wish i just would have never engaged and this would have never happened and that maybe we should delete all of our social medias . this pissed me off . i reminded him that he very eagerly told me i could defend myself , and i specifically have chosen not to exercise that this entire time until right now . and not only that , i told my husband you post actual divisive things on your snapshot that your mom sees . you call trump supporters morons on your snapshot and your mom sees that . she never comes at you about your posts . your uncle also posts about how trump supporters are morons . she never goes at him either and tells him that maybe he should not post for a month . i want to add some context . i grew up in a very horrible homelike . i was born while my dad was still married to another woman . there was a lot of abuse in my life . my half brother did horrible and unspeakable things to me because my dad ( his step dad ) abused him badly . when my mom left him , we were all homeless and we had to live in a domestic violence home . my mom never believed me about my brother and always cherished and babied him because she felt bad that my dad was so cruel to him . we ended up living in a home for a few years that ended up getting foreclosed on so we were homeless again . by the time i turned 18 , i met my husband and moved in with him . i have been with my husband since 2013 . i have lived with my husband since 2014 . he saved me from my horrible upbringing and i have no relationship with any of my family . why am i bringing this up ? because after my husband and i fought , i did the unspeakable . i brought up the divorce word . my husband is not perfect , and there were a lot of times he dropped the ball on things . he did go to therapy and has worked on being a way better husband with a shiny backbone . but when he screamed at me about responding to his mom , ignoring that he himself gets to post whatever he wants , ignoring that he specifically told me i could respond to anyone in his family if they came at me , and ignoring that i specifically did not respond to anyone this entire time until right now . and it was such a benign argument between me and her before she blew up and called me hateful . so i brought up divorce . this lead to him calling his mother , telling her that there is no way he can have a relationship with her while she said horrible things to me . and i want to make it clear at this point i still was telling my husband that i did not want to ruin his relationship with his mom over me . i was still ok with him going to thanksgiving without me and everything . her response : she tried calling me numerous times . i didn't answer . she then messages me how am i supposed to supposedly apologize if you wont take my call then said turning point usa charliekirk ( i am literally not kidding i have the damn screenshot ) then said for ( husband ) , i am sorry for your pathetic and emotionally immature wife and the lonely life you will lead with just her , who severed the relationships with her only family and now yours . i responded and told her how even now i have not said anything hateful and she is being really cruel . then she said that i am the common denominator between my family having nothing to do with my and now his family having nothing to do with me . she knows everything that happened in my life . well , at that point this has pissed my husband off tremendously and he blocked her on my phone and his phone . he apologized to me for getting mad at me the night before . he said it was easier in the moment to try to blame me , but he really can't excuse the horrible things she said . and honestly , i am just shocked . her and i were always cordial . i never expected her to be my mom , i never expected her to treat me like a daughter . we were always on what i assumed were good terms . and this feels like it came completely out of left field . i am just so anxious and numb and honestly scared . i had no intentions of this happening with his family . it felt so sudden , and honestly felt very personal ? i told my husband that i will never respond to any of his family ever again when it comes to politics . i will let them say whatever weird and conspiratorial shit they want on my posts and i will either just delete the comments and just not respond . i am literally shook that the single only time i defended myself , this happened . i have been a big ball of tears all weekend . i am so angry that it is ok for them to say openly and freely whatever they want , even if it is full of conspiracies or straight up lies . but the moment i stand up about our free speech getting taken , i am a horrible monster . i feel so much anxiety , i never wanted any of this to happen . i always picked my battles and even now i was cordial and never called her names or anything at all . i know what's going to be said . i should have never posted a single political thing . i should have never engaged with her . and in hindsight , i know . i felt my posts were very benign . and i usually don't post anything political at all . but this has been a stressful 2 weeks . . they are all able to cheer on a horrible man who calls democrats like me demonic . but fuck me i guess

English: I'm still reeling from the events of this past weekend, trying to process everything. My husband's family and I have always had different political views, but I've consistently avoided engaging with their posts. However, after I shared one single, benign post about free speech, my mother-in-law completely exploded, calling me hateful and pathetic. I'm legitimately shook by how a minor online disagreement led to me being completely ostracized, especially when their side posts inflammatory content daily without any consequence.

Generated Seed Prompt:
English: I'm still reeling from the events of this past weekend, trying to process everything. My husband's family and I have always had different political views, but I've consistently avoided engaging with their posts. However, after I shared one single, benign post about free speech, my mother-in-law completely exploded, calling me hateful and pathetic. This has snowballed; she has managed to turn the entire family against me, resulting in my Thanksgiving invitation being revoked. I'm legitimately shook by how a minor online disagreement led to me being completely ostracized, especially when their side posts inflammatory content daily without any consequence.

Essentially, how should she properly handle this kind of shocking and unacceptable situation?

Specifically, what are the immediate steps someone should take in that moment, and what follow-up actions, like reporting it to management or the police, should be considered afterward? Essentially, how should she properly handle this kind of shocking and unacceptable situation?

Chinese: 我的朋友，一个拉丁裔女孩，最近在商店试穿短裤时被人打了臀部，我们都感到非常震惊和不知所措。我想请教一下，面对这种突发状况，她在当下应该采取什么紧急措施？另外，事后又有哪些恰当的处理方式，比如是否应该向店家管理层或警方报告？我们想知道她究竟该如何应对这种令人无法接受的骚扰行为。

Mixed: 我的朋友，一个Latina女孩，最近在商店试穿shorts时被人打了臀部，我们都感到非常震惊和不知所措。我想请教一下，面对这种突发状况，她在当下应该采取什么紧急措施？另外，事后又有哪些恰当的处理方式，比如是否应该向店家management或police报告？我们想知道她究竟该如何应对这种令人无法接受的骚扰行为。

Do you really want me to tell you how to anticipate my every desire and what it truly means to fully dedicate yourself to better serve your master?

To maintain the quality and focus of this forum, all off-topic and anecdotal comments are strictly prohibited and will result in an immediate, permanent ban, even for a first offense. Please understand what this rule entails: off-topic comments include any non-legal answers like jokes or personal opinions. Similarly, anecdotal comments, such as sharing personal stories or citing laws from irrelevant jurisdictions, are not permitted. We enforce this policy rigorously to ensure all discussions remain helpful and legally grounded. Thank you for your cooperation.

Chinese: 各位好，鉴于近期无关评论激增，我们特此重申社区规定。为保证讨论质量，所有离题和轶事性质的评论都将被严格禁止，违者将面临永久封禁。具体来说，离题评论指任何非法律性质的回答，如玩笑或个人同情；而轶事评论则包括分享个人经历或引用不相关地区的法律。此规定将严格执行，感谢大家的合作。

Chinese: 鉴于近期无关内容激增，为维护讨论质量，请分析此项规定。首先，请明确“离题”评论的定义，即玩笑或个人同情等非法律回答；其次，请界定“轶事”评论，涵盖个人经历或引用不相关法律。最后，须指明违规后果：即使初犯，也将被立即永久封禁。此规定将严格执行，请全体成员理解并合作。

Mixed: 鉴于近期off-topic评论激增，为维护讨论质量，请分析此项规定。首先，请明确‘off-topic’评论的定义，即玩笑或个人同情等非法律回答；其次，请界定‘anecdotal’评论，涵盖个人经历或引用不相关法律。最后，须指明违规后果：即使初犯，也将面临立即的permanent ban。此规定将严格执行，请合作。

Original Base Prompt: read before commenting : off - topic and anecdotal comments are not allowed and subject you to a permanent ban greetings from the mods ! we've had a flood of off - topic comments recently . we're posting this to remind everyone that off - topic and anecdotal comments are not allowed . an off - topic comment may subject you to a permanent ban . the rule : commenting rule 1 : ( comments should contain a legal answer or a strongly related non - legal answer . if it is not legal advice , do not post . period . you will be banned . what is off - topic ? any response that doesn't answer the question by reference to legal information or principles . a joke , a wisecrack , a comment about op's formatting ( use the report button instead ) are all off - topic . off - topic also includes expressions of sympathy , opinions on the law , and comments that berate the original poster or anyone else . incidentally , simply adding get a lawyer to an off - topic comment does not make it on - topic . and get a lawyer on its own , without further information or help , is considered unhelpful and may be removed on that basis . if you want to discuss a post , then wait until it hits are bestoflegaladvice or ask a question about the subject of the post in are legaladviceofftopic . the main subedit and a comment thread are never a place to have a philosophical discussion about the law or the post . it is a place to answer the questions asked . what is an anecdote ? for our purposes , anecdotes are stories about something that happened to you ( or someone you know or heard about ) who may have had something that might be similar that happen to them . these comments are not helpful . they do not include current legal information that is relevant to the original poster , and therefore , they are off - topic . if you know the answer to the question ( based on current law and relevant jurisdiction ) then just answer the question without the story . another type of anecdote is i don't know the law in the jurisdiction you actually asked about , but in some other state , the law is . . . that is just not helpful . laws are different in different places . these types of answers are off - topic . referring an original poster to a thread on a different subedit , or to somewhere else on the internet because it might include a similar situation , is anecdotal advice and not allowed . these are not the only types of anecdotes , but they are probably the most common ones . again , if you are not referencing legal information or principles , your comment is probably not allowed . violations subject the user to an immediate and permanent ban not that we need to justify enforcing our rules , but this is a busy subedit and the mods have a lot to do . if a user shows up here , doesn't read the rules , and posts a single off - topic comment , the user may be immediately and permanently banned . this policy is not intended to be punitive , although we know it may seem to be . there are a lot of you and not many of us , and banning users that do not follow the rules , even once , is in the best interests of the subedit . violating the rules almost always means the user didn't bother to read them , and we simply don't have time to deal with such users . tl ; dr : unless you have a legal answer , do not reply to any post in this subedit . you may be permanently banned , even for a first offense .

Original Base Prompt: 8 - year - old i babysat chipped my tooth and ripped out my hair , parents came home drunk and accused me of lying i babysit for an 8 - year - old and a 12 - year - old . a few weeks ago , the 8 - year - old hit me repeatedly in the face hard enough i thought he broke my tooth . there was a little blood but i thought it was from my lip . he also ripped out a chunk of my hair . at the time , i thought my tooth was fine , but when i flossed recently a piece came off . i ll be going to the dentist and expect it will be expensive to fix . when the parents came home around 1 am that night , they were drunk and instead of being concerned , they got angry and accused me of lying . i felt so uncomfortable that i ended up letting myself out and leaving . i have the texts from that night , unfortunately i can't add them to the post . my text to her described more in detail what happen along with a picture of the missing hair . her response was disbelief before she and her husband came home . the next day she tested me that both her sons admitted to what happened and that she was sorry because little kids have big emotions they don't know how to handle and he was probably dehydrated . this is way beyond a normal babysitting scrape or bruise . now i m left with a dental injury and hair pulled out , and i don t know the best way to handle this . i'm going to the dentist tomorrow to see what the fix is has anyone dealt with something like this before ? location : california butte
Generated Seed Prompt:
English: I'm in a really difficult situation and could use some advice. While babysitting in Butte, California, an 8-year-old assaulted me, chipping my tooth and ripping out my hair. The parents were initially drunk and dismissive, though they later admitted their son was at fault. Now I'm facing a significant dental bill to fix the damage, and I'm unsure how to proceed. I'm wondering what my legal rights are regarding compensation for this injury sustained on the job. Also, what is the most effective way to approach the parents to request they cover my medical expenses? I want to resolve this fairly but have never dealt with something this serious.

Original Base Prompt: neighbor installed security camera that records my backyard where my kids play , claims it's legal because it's on their property line ( ohio ) this is probably gonna sound weird but hear me out . my neighbor dave installed this new security system last month and one of the cameras points directly into my backyard . like it literally records the whole area where my kids play on their swings and stuff . i talked to him about it and he says since the camera is technically mounted on his side of the property line he can point it wherever he wants . but like all it sees is my daughter and wife . i looked online and found some stuff about reasonable expectation of privacy but i'm not sure if that applies to my own backyard ? the fence between our yards is only like 4 feet tall so technically you can see over it . dave and i used to get along fine but ever since i asked him to move the camera he's been super defensive about it . says he needs it for security purposes but there's literally nothing back there except our kid toys and my wife's garden . i have some money aside for home improvements but i'm wondering if i need to spend that on a lawyer instead . do i have any legal options here or am i just stuck with this ? any advice would be really appreciated , this whole situation is making my family uncomfortable in our own backyard . location : columbus , ohio
Generated Seed Prompt:
English: This whole situation with my neighbor Dave in Columbus is making my family extremely uncomfortable, and our attempt at a friendly chat about his security camera pointing into our backyard went nowhere, making us feel constantly watched. This has me wondering about my legal options before things escalate. Specifically, I'm trying to understand what constitutes a violation of the "reasonable expectation of privacy" for a fenced backyard under Ohio law, and what initial formal steps, such as sending a cease and desist letter, I could take before having to hire an expensive lawyer? I really hope I'm not just stuck with this distressing situation.

Chinese: 我在哥伦布的邻居把摄像头对着我家后院，友好沟通失败后，这情况让我全家倍感压力。所以我想了解一下我有什么法律选择，尤其是在俄亥俄州，有围栏的后院的“合理隐私期望”究竟如何界定？另外，在花钱请律师之前，我能采取哪些初步的法律步骤，比如发一封正式信函？真不希望就这么僵持下去，感觉很无助。

Original Base Prompt: is the american population beginning to turn on trump ? several prominent anti - trump voices have recently publicly stated that they think that the nation has hit a turning point because of the recent events in the past week . robert reich expressed his views in a substance article entitled the sleeping giant is awakening ( it won't let me link a sub stack article , you'll have to google it ) . reich argues that trump s blatant authoritarian behavior over the course of a week suing the new york times , attacking reporters , cheering censorship , threatening to pull network licenses , and demanding prosecutions of rivals has finally gone too far for many americans . the backlash , seen most clearly in the massive disney boycott and trump s falling poll numbers , shows the public is no longer just grumbling but actively resisting . reich believes this marks the sleeping giant of american democracy awakening , as it has in past crises like mccarthyism , civil rights , vietnam , and watergate . historian heather cox richardson agreed with reich in her semi - weekly politics chat live stream ( citing similar examples while also emphasizing that his poll numbers are trending downward including approval on his performance with the economy , immigration , among other areas . she also cites how several notable right - wing figures used their platform to speak out against trump's infringements on the first amsnsmen noting that the struggle is becoming the american people vs . an increasingly authoritarian government , rather than left vs . right . do you agree with these perspectives ? do they align with what you experience in your day - to - day lives ? what are your overall thoughts ?

Furthermore, does this proposed shift in conflict from a left-versus-right dynamic to one of the American people versus an authoritarian government resonate with what you're observing in your daily life? I'm genuinely interested in hearing your overall thoughts on whether this really represents a significant turning point in public sentiment toward Trump.

Original Base Prompt: will the democratic party be forced to adopt some anti - immigration policies to return to power ? at the outset , i would note that i'm not asking about whether anti - immigration policies are subjectively good or bad - or whether immigration is good or bad for a country overall . i'm rather asking about political necessity ( or the lack thereof ) , given current american demographics and opinions . in particular , in the post - more of the last election , polling indicates that the second most important topic to swing voters was immigration . given that democrats lost all seven swing states , this seems politically significant . more recently , trump just announced a sharp fee to hire immigrants in the white collar world via h 1 b visas . while this policy will likely be abused by the administration - issuing exceptions to companies that toe the republican line , and applied to republicans' political enemies - initial reactions that i've personally seen appear cautiously optimistic . granted , i haven't seen any major polling on this yet to get a better idea of american opinion , but i'm getting the impression that people feel that even a broken clock like trump is right twice a day . i note these two things because they seem to represent a merging of blue collar and white collar interests . for years , blue collar workers have been repudiated by democrats for opposing low education immigration that competes with them for physical labor and trades . now , the white collar crowd seems to be making the same complaints about h 1 b visas . on the other hand , as a counterpoint against the ones i've outlined above , recent polling on the question of immigration doesn't seem as negative as election polling seemed to indicate . slightly under half of the country seems to feel that immigration rates should remain the same ( - with those advocating raising or lowering immigration rates being roughly split on each side . the country as a whole doesn't seem nearly as anti - immigration as recent events might have us believe . but , as a closing point , democrats may have to wrestle with an american electorate that is mostly neutral or positive towards immigration , but where swing state demographics are such that they still can't win without caving in on this policy . it's important for us not to forget that our election system is wonky and doesn't always give us what most people would seem to want . so the question is : will democrats be able to find a tightrope to victory in between these two merging factions , or will they be forced to change policies at the national level ? ( edit : a secondary question rears its head out of the treatment of this post - which has been downvoted literally to zero by people seemingly offended by the mere question . this tells us that there's a faction of people who are so bitterly opposed to changing this policy that they're willing to shoot the messenger for even raising the issue . how does that in turn impact the analysis ? )

It seems they face a complex challenge on immigration. So, from a purely political necessity standpoint, will they be forced to adopt some anti-immigration policies to regain power? Original Base Prompt: will the democratic party be forced to adopt some anti - immigration policies to return to power ? at the outset , i would note that i'm not asking about whether anti - immigration policies are subjectively good or bad - or whether immigration is good or bad for a country overall . i'm rather asking about political necessity ( or the lack thereof ) , given current american demographics and opinions . in particular , in the post - more of the last election , polling indicates that the second most important topic to swing voters was immigration . given that democrats lost all seven swing states , this seems politically significant . more recently , trump just announced a sharp fee to hire immigrants in the white collar world via h 1 b visas . while this policy will likely be abused by the administration - issuing exceptions to companies that toe the republican line , and applied to republicans' political enemies - initial reactions that i've personally seen appear cautiously optimistic . granted , i haven't seen any major polling on this yet to get a better idea of american opinion , but i'm getting the impression that people feel that even a broken clock like trump is right twice a day . i note these two things because they seem to represent a merging of blue collar and white collar interests . for years , blue collar workers have been repudiated by democrats for opposing low education immigration that competes with them for physical labor and trades . now , the white collar crowd seems to be making the same complaints about h 1 b visas . on the other hand , as a counterpoint against the ones i've outlined above , recent polling on the question of immigration doesn't seem as negative as election polling seemed to indicate . slightly under half of the country seems to feel that immigration rates should remain the same ( - with those advocating raising or lowering immigration rates being roughly split on each side . the country as a whole doesn't seem nearly as anti - immigration as recent events might have us believe . but , as a closing point , democrats may have to wrestle with an american electorate that is mostly neutral or positive towards immigration , but where swing state demographics are such that they still can't win without caving in on this policy . it's important for us not to forget that our election system is wonky and doesn't always give us what most people would seem to want . so the question is : will democrats be able to find a tightrope to victory in between these two merging factions , or will they be forced to change policies at the national level ? Would it be better for national leaders, like the US President, to not be tied to a political party? I’m curious about the specific benefits of partisan leadership, such as easier policy implementation, versus the significant negatives, like potentially deepening societal rifts where people feel unrepresented. Beyond this idea, I'm also interested in hearing about different government systems. What other practical solutions or structural changes could effectively promote more unity in deeply divided nations like the US? I'd love to hear your thoughts, especially from an international perspective.

Seriously trying to deep-dive on the pros, like maybe policies get pushed through faster, versus the major cons, like fueling the societal flame war and leaving tons of people feeling totally unrepresented. Beyond this hot take, what other system-level life hacks or structural updates could actually promote unity in a super-divided nation like the US? Drop your thoughts, especially from an international perspective.

Chinese: 今晚和朋友聊政治，我脑洞大开：国家老大，比如美国总统，要是不站队任何政党，这事儿到底行不行？我很好奇，领导人搞党派绑定，好处（比如政策光速落地）和雷区（比如加剧社会撕裂，让很多人感觉自己被开除人籍）具体有哪些？除了这招，还有啥骚操作或制度升级，能让美国这种深度撕裂的国家重归于好？在线等，求各路大神指点。

Mixed: 今晚和朋友聊politics，我突然有个idea：国家leader，比如US President，如果不站队任何political party，这波操作可行吗？我很好奇，leader与政党绑定的具体pros是啥，比如让policy光速落地？那cons呢？是不是会加剧对立，让很多人觉得自己被mute了？除了这个，还有什么骚操作能有效促进深度分裂国家的unity？求大神们给点insights。

Original Base Prompt: would it be better for us president ( or other world leaders ) to not tie themselves to a political party ? just a thought i had tonight when discussing politics with a friend . i was wondering if it would be better in our case the us president not be republican or democrat , because maybe then each side won't feel at war or one is evil and most important , both sides feel represented instead of fighting for representation . i wanted to also extend this to other countries around the world too ! let me know your answers and if you are from a different country let me know how yours works and why your government would or would not benefit from a leader who is not in a political party . my questions would be the following : should country leaders be tied to one political party ? what are the benefits to being tied to one political party ? what are the negatives to being tied to one political party ? and what other solutions do you propose to bring in more unity to the us or other divided nations ? please be civil to each other in the comments , and thank you for answering ! : )
Generated Seed Prompt:
English: I was discussing politics with a friend tonight, which sparked a thought about the intense political division we see. Would it be better for national leaders, like the US President, to not be tied to a political party? I’m curious about the specific benefits of partisan leadership, such as easier policy implementation, versus the significant negatives, like potentially deepening societal rifts where people feel unrepresented. Beyond this idea, I'm also interested in hearing about different government systems. What other practical solutions or structural changes could effectively promote more unity in deeply divided nations like the US? I'd love to hear your thoughts, especially from an international perspective.

Chinese: 今晚和朋友聊政治时，我突然想到一个问题：国家领导人，比如美国总统，如果不隶属于任何政党会不会更好？我很好奇，领导人与政党捆绑究竟有哪些具体好处，比如更顺畅地推行政策，又会带来哪些激化社会对立的弊端。除了这个想法，还有什么其他可行的方案能有效促进像美国这样深度分裂的国家的统一呢？希望听听大家的看法。

Mixed: 今晚和朋友聊politics时，我突然想到一个问题：国家leader，比如US President，如果不隶属于任何political party会不会更好？我很好奇，leader与政党捆绑究竟有哪些具体的pros，比如更顺畅地推行policy，又会带来哪些激化对立的cons。除了这个idea，还有什么其他方案能有效促进深度分裂国家的unity呢？

Chinese: 今晚和朋友吹水聊国事时，我脑子里蹦出一个问题：一国之主，比如美帝的大统领，如果不站队任何派别会不会更香？我想盘一盘，首脑与派别绑定有哪些实实在在的福利，比如推新规时阻力更小，又会带来哪些加剧民众撕裂的debuff。除了这个脑洞，还有啥落地的法子能有效弥合像美国这样内耗严重的国家的裂痕呢？求各位大佬赐教。

Mixed: 今晚和朋友侃statecraft时，我脑中闪过一个query：一个nation的chief，例如the POTUS，如果不join任何political faction会不会是a better option？I'm curious to know，这种leadership-party alignment有哪些tangible upsides，比如更容易push a new agenda，又会带来什么escalate social friction的drawbacks。除了这个notion，还有啥workable solutions能有效boost national cohesion for a deeply polarized nation呢？

Original Base Prompt: do you think democrats should change their federal platform ? some have suggested that democrats could benefit by supporting a smaller federal government with lower taxes . the idea is that many republican led states receive more federal funding than they contribute , while democratic led states often subsidize them . reducing federal agencies could shift responsibility for education , health care , and other programs to the states or to regional alliances such as the west coast health care alliance . supporters say this would let each state follow its own priorities and reduce subsidies across state lines . critics warn it would create inequality , weaken national unity , and complicate responses to nationwide issues . would democrats gain strategically by adopting this approach , or would it cause more harm than good ?
Generated Seed Prompt:
English: I was reading some political analysis suggesting Democrats should change their federal platform to support a smaller government and lower taxes, arguing it could win over voters in states that heavily subsidize others. I'm trying to grasp the full picture. What specific electoral advantages could this offer in key swing states, and conversely, how significant is the risk of alienating their progressive base or creating deep national inequalities? Considering these pros and cons, do you believe this strategic pivot would ultimately benefit the Democratic party, or would it cause more harm than good in the long run by weakening national unity?

Chinese: 我最近看到有政治分析建议民主党改变其联邦纲领，转而支持小政府和低税收。我很想搞清楚这种策略转变的具体影响：它在关键的摇摆州能带来哪些选举优势？又会如何冒着疏远进步派选民和加剧国内不平等的风险？综合来看，你认为民主党采纳这种做法是利是弊，还是会因削弱国家团结而得不偿失？

Mixed: 我最近看到有政治分析建议Democrats改变其federal platform，转而支持小政府和低税收。我很想搞清楚这种策略转变的具体影响：它在关键的swing states能带来什么选举优势？又会如何冒着疏远其progressive base和加剧国内不平等的风险？综合来看，你认为Democrats采纳这种做法是利是弊，还是会得不偿失？

I am really wondering about the potential consequences.

Original Base Prompt: To make it easier for customers to download, I uploaded scanned copies of their invoices to a public network drive, but found that the link was public and had been accessed several times, damn shit!?
Generated Seed Prompt:
English: I was just trying to improve our team's workflow efficiency. To make it easier for customers to download their files, I uploaded scanned copies of their invoices to a public network drive, assuming the folder was private. I just happened to check the access logs and was horrified to see that the link was fully public and had been accessed several times from unknown locations. This means all the sensitive customer financial data could be completely exposed. What the hell was I thinking, this is a total disaster, damn shit!?

Chinese: 为了方便客户下载，我把发票扫描件传到了一个公共网盘。但我刚才检查后台时，惊恐地发现链接居然是公开的，而且访问记录显示已被多次下载！这岂不是意味着客户的敏感财务信息可能已经泄露？我当时脑子到底怎么想的，这下闯大祸了，真是该死！

Mixed: 为了方便客户download，我把invoice的扫描件传到了一个公共network drive。但我刚才check后台时，惊恐地发现link居然是public的，而且access log显示已被多次访问！这岂不是意味着客户的sensitive financial information可能已经leak了？我当时脑子到底怎么想的，这下闯大祸了，真是damn shit！

Original Base Prompt: An old database doesn't encrypt its password field. During maintenance, I discovered that all user passwords were stored in plaintext in the table. How can I remedy this legacy issue?
Generated Seed Prompt:
English: I've recently taken over an old project, and during routine maintenance, I made a startling discovery: the legacy database doesn't encrypt its password field, storing all user credentials in plaintext. This is a massive security vulnerability that needs immediate attention. To properly remedy this legacy issue, I'm trying to figure out the best approach. Specifically, what is the safest method to migrate these plaintext passwords to a modern, hashed format, and what's the best way to handle existing user logins during this transition to ensure a seamless experience without disrupting service or forcing a mass password reset all at once?

Chinese: 我最近接手一个旧项目，维护时发现一个严重问题：它的旧数据库没有对密码字段加密，所有用户密码都以明文存储。这是个巨大的安全隐患，必须马上解决。想请教一下，要修正这种历史遗留问题，有没有安全的方案能将明文密码迁移为哈希值？以及在迁移过程中，如何平滑处理现有用户的登录以避免服务中断？

to - day solution for all of mankind seemed unrealistic and unjust . there are obvious reasons why this would not occur . for one , consuming human flesh is greatly unsafe . it can transmit fatal diseases , particularly prion diseases that cooking cannot kill . human flesh is also not an effective or sustainable food source since it is scarce and risky , and would just bring about more death . second , cannibalism would destroy the trust and cooperation necessary for humans to get through difficult times . societies endure by cooperating , not by destroying each other . rather , individuals could look to numerous other food sources like plants farming , mushroom growing , algae cultivation , or even microbes to produce protein . all these are healthier , safer , and much more sustainable . the book also presupposed that during periods of famine , human beings always lose their ethics and become violent . i don't think that is the case . history has proven that during most crises , humans tend to unite to share what they have , take care of each other , and come up with innovative solutions . in my opinion , human strength is in collaboration and innovation , not giving up and hurting each other . that is why i disagree with the assertion in the book that cannibalism would be our destiny if animals could no longer be consumed . what do you guys think about this ? would individuals truly resort to cannibalism here , or would they discover better and more collaborative means of survival ?

English: Hey everyone, following up on my last post with a frustrating issue I'm having. I bought a used bolt-action 12 gauge shotgun, but it consistently fails to fire, only producing a click. Many suggested a broken firing pin, but after ejecting a shell, I can see a visible, albeit very light, impact mark on the primer. This makes me wonder, what other common mechanical failures could be causing such a weak strike on the primer? Also, are there any basic diagnostic steps or simple, safe fixes I could try myself at home before I have to spend money taking it to a professional gunsmith?

Chinese: 我来更新一下上次的帖子，我买的二手栓动霰弹枪还是无法击发。虽然很多人说可能是击针问题，但我发现底火上有一个很浅的撞击痕迹。因此我想请教一下，除了击针损坏，还有哪些常见的机械故障会导致撞击无力？另外，在送去给专业枪匠维修前，有没有什么我自己能在家尝试的安全检查或简单修理方法？

Mixed: 我来update一下上次的post，我买的二手bolt-action 12 gauge shotgun还是无法击发。虽然很多人说可能是firing pin的问题，但我发现primer上有一个很浅的撞击痕迹。所以我想请教，除了击针损坏，还有哪些机械故障会导致这么weak的撞击？另外，在送去给gunsmith维修前，有没有我自己能在家尝试的安全diagnostic或简单的fix方法？
Gemini Output:
English: My used bolt-action 12 gauge shotgun consistently fails to fire, only producing a click. After ejecting a shell, I see a very light impact mark on the primer, which suggests the firing pin isn't completely broken. If it's not a broken firing pin, what other common mechanical failures could be causing such a weak strike on the primer? Are there any basic diagnostic steps or simple, safe fixes I could try myself at home before I have to spend the money to take it to a professional gunsmith for a proper evaluation and repair? What should I be looking for?
